catalyst.context: Alkali metal (Li, Na, K and Rb) doped g-C 3 N 4 were successfully prepared by water bath heating and high temperature calcination method. Absorption spectra of Rb doped g-C 3 N 4 increases remarkably over 500-1100 nm wavelengths. Rb doped g-C 3 N 4 showed the best photo-reduction CO 2 performance with CO productivity about 12.1 mol g -1 .

light source.source: The UV-Vis DRS results indicated that the K and Rb dopants broaden the spectrum of g-C 3 N 4 obviously.
light source.context: All in all, we have studied the effect of alkali metals on the optical properties of g-C 3 N 4 .The pure g-C 3 N 4 and alkali metal doped g-C 3 N 4 were prepared by solvothermal method and high temperature calcination method, respectively.At the same time, the samples were also characterized by XRD and FT-IR.The UV-Vis DRS results indicated that the K and Rb dopants broaden the spectrum of g-C 3 N 4 obviously.Based on the DFT calculations, the intrinsic and metals doping of g-C 3 N 4 were studied.The computational results show that K and Rb dopants can enlarge the absorption range of g-C 3 N 4 , which is consistent with the experimental results.This research provides an important theoretical basis for the preparation of doped g-C 3 N 4 photocatalyst with excellent performance. operation mode.source: 3.0 g melamine with 0.1 g alkali metal nitrates (LiNO 3 , NaNO 3 , KNO 3 , RbNO 3 ) were respectively dispersed in a beaker containing 15 mL deionized water and ultrasound for 5 h.
operation mode.context: LiNO 3 (99), NaNO 3 (99), KNO 3 (99), RbNO 3 (99) were all purchased from Sinopharm Reagent Co., Ltd.Melamine (AR, 98) is supported from Aladdin Chemistry Co., Ltd.And the experimental water is deionized water. 3.0 g melamine with 0.1 g alkali metal nitrates (LiNO 3 , NaNO 3 , KNO 3 , RbNO 3 ) were respectively dispersed in a beaker containing 15 mL deionized water and ultrasound for 5 h.Then place it in a water bath and stir at 70 C until the solution is evaporated to dryness.After that, place the above finely grind mixture into a temperature-programmed muffle furnace and calcined at 500 C for 2 h at a heating rate of 2.3 Cmin -1 .Subsequently, grind the yellow product to powder, and calcined at 350 C for 3 h at a heating rate of 20 Cmin -1 at atmosphere, the alkali metal doped g-C 3 N 4 (Li-CN, Na-CN, K-CN, Rb-CN) were obtained. The crystal structure of a series of materials were investigated by means of a D/max-RAX-ray diffractometer (Rigaku, Japan).The Fourier transform infrared (FT-IR) spectrometer was collected by a Nicolet Magna-IR 550 spectrometer (Nicolet, USA).The optical properties were studied by the UV-vis spectrophotometer (Shimadzu UV-3600).Electrochemical impedance spectroscopy was studied by three-electrode electrochemical station of CHI 660C.In addition, the CO 2 temperature-programmed desorption are carried out by Quantachrome autosorb-iQ-C chemisorption analyzer.
